name: rawness
content:
rawness noun [U]
(EMOTION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of feelings or qualities) the fact of being powerful and difficult to control: The demise of the relationship is heartbreaking, mainly because of the rawness of Emma's emotions. Children may wish to protect the adults around them from the rawness of their feelings.
(of a piece of writing, film, etc.) a powerful quality that comes from not trying to hide anything about its subject: The play's rawness and honesty drew them all in. The series aims for a rawness that depicts the troubled aspects of people in crisis.
More examplesFewer examplesThese incidents show the rawness of political and religious sensitivities at the moment.The campaign has brought out the rawness of feelings on both sides.There's an honesty and rawness to the music.

rawness noun [U]
(PAIN)
(of skin) the quality of being sore or painful because of being rubbed or damaged: If you have rawness and itching between your toes, you probably have athlete's foot. Irritant contact dermatitis is characterized mostly by sensations of rawness or burning.
More examplesFewer examplesIn time, the rawness of the skin will heal.
